page.title: 15VILLAGE OF FELIXKIRK
page.content: Felixkirk is a small pretty village nestling under the Hambleton Hills. There is an unusually attractive Village Hall which is used for village meetings, Parish Council meetings, evening classes, Parochial Church Council meetings and once a year the Women's Institute meet there. The daily newspapers are delivered to the village hall and are then collected by the villagers during the day. The church of St Felix is a well cared for building in the centre of the village. One bus per week operates between the village and Thirsk on market day, The children attend schools in Thirsk and are transported daily in school buses. There are no shops in the village but four mobile shops visit each week and the mobile library calls every two weeks.
